title: How to Detect a Disinformation Campaign - Media Ecosystems Analysis Group
snippet: This article includes a discussion with Fabio Giglietto about detecting disinformation campaigns. He explains that coordination between social media actors is a signal for spotting misinformation and discusses how actors adapt to platforms' attempts to crack down on coordinated behavior. He also shares his research on COVID-19 misinformation in Italy.
description: The article is a discussion with Fabio Giglietto about detecting disinformation campaigns, focusing on coordination between social media actors and his research on COVID-19 misinformation in Italy.

title: Coordinated Sharing Behavior Detection Conference
snippet: Fabio Giglietto (Urbino) is one of the speakers at the Coordinated Sharing Behavior Detection Conference, a satellite event of #AoIR2024 focusing on multimodal and cross-platform CIB detection.
description: Fabio Giglietto from the University of Urbino is a speaker at the Coordinated Sharing Behavior Detection Conference, a satellite event of AoIR2024, which focuses on multimodal and cross-platform CIB detection.

title: 'Big Data' | Snurblog — Axel Bruns
snippet: Reports on Fabio Giglietto's presentation at the AoIR 2025 conference in Rio de Janeiro, where he presented a study of pro-Bolsonaro narratives on Facebook in Brazil, questioning the stability of online hyperpartisan groups during political crises.
description: This blog post on 'Big Data' mentions Fabio Giglietto's presentation at the AoIR 2025 conference in Rio de Janeiro, where he discussed a study on pro-Bolsonaro narratives on Facebook in Brazil and the stability of online hyperpartisan groups during political crises.

title: Integrating Large Language Models in Political Discourse Studies on Social Media: Challenges of Validating an LLMs-in-the-loop - UniUrb
snippet: This paper mentions Giglietto's (2024) research on the same dataset demonstrated that LLMs outperform fully fine-tuned transformer models in NLP tasks.
description: The paper "Integrating Large Language Models in Political Discourse Studies on Social Media: Challenges of Validating an LLMs-in-the-loop" mentions Fabio Giglietto's 2024 research comparing LLMs and fine-tuned transformer models. This indicates a third-party citation of his work in a related field.

title: In the Shadows of Disinformation: Fake News and Violations of Human Rights - ResearchGate
snippet: Fabio Giglietto et al. are cited in this study for their definition of disinformation as deliberately false information intended to deceive, often for political or economic goals. The study examines disinformation and fake news in relation to human rights.
description: This ResearchGate study, published in 2024, cites Fabio Giglietto's definition of disinformation in the context of human rights violations and fake news. It's a third-party mention relating to his expertise in disinformation studies.

title: Commissioni riunite Cultura e Trasporti della Camera (2.12.2025) - Radio Radicale
Il Premio Rimini Mundi a sette ambasciatori del congressuale - lapiazzarimini.it
Il movimento religioso cinese che si è infiltrato in un gruppo Facebook urbinate - il Ducato
The persistence and resilience of misinformation in the face of fact checking - vera.ai
snippet: A project by vera.ai, entitled “The Persistence and Resilience of Misinformation in the Face of Fact Checking,” was facilitated by Fabio Giglietto, Massimo Terenzi ( UNIURB) and Richard Rogers (UvA) at the Digital Media Initiative Winter School at the University of Amsterdam.
description: The content is about a project concerning the persistence and resilience of misinformation. Fabio Giglietto is mentioned as a facilitator of this project at a Digital Media Initiative Winter School.
